channel.title: Error Connecting/Port Forward Problem?
channel.description: I can't connect to my server unless it is on 127.0.0.1, and nobody else can either. I have portforwarded 43594, and made a no-ip. When I check the port on a google checker it says its open. Also, when I check the server status checker for my no-ip, it says it is online.. I changed the server IP in the client I am using, But for some reason it wont connect. Is there something I am missing? Somebody please help.

item.title: Error Connecting/Port Forward Problem?
item.dc:creator: @Runecessor Runecessor
item.description:
@Runecessor wrote:

Make sure you changed the source side as well. depending on your source it could be in the following:
Server.java
Config.java
Client.java

and check your client it will be in one if not all of the following:
Client.java
Gui.java
EGui.java

If you have done all of that make sure you port forwarded both the TCP and UDP ports, depending on the router you may need to use TCP on 1 and UDP on another and then both TCP and UDP on the 3rd so it can all vary. Also NO-IP sucks just go to myip on Google and use that as your server ip address.

Read full topic

item.title: Error Connecting/Port Forward Problem?
item.dc:creator: @arean1 arean1
item.description:
@arean1 wrote:

Make sure DUC.exe is still running in the background. Try adding the port 43594 to your firewall’s exception list.

Read full topic

item.title: Error Connecting/Port Forward Problem?
item.dc:creator: @shapesnatch shapesnatch
item.description:
@shapesnatch wrote:

I can’t connect to my server unless it is on 127.0.0.1, and nobody else can either.
I have portforwarded 43594, and made a no-ip. When I check the port on a google checker it says its open.
Also, when I check the server status checker for my no-ip, it says it is online… I changed the server IP in the client I am using, But for some reason it wont connect.
Is there something I am missing?
Somebody please help.

Read full topic
